padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427773">aviegravy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-23">01/23/23 19:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smoky and biting from the fir and incense, but smoothed beautifully by the rich coffee and oud at the base. rich, herbal, sweet and gorgeous, just a little bit mature and classic for me. to my nose, this is 80% similar to cafe cabanel, which im seriously considering.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1741754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1741754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1740579" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1740579" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Evenlesscreative"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1659091"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Evenlesscreative" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lake-Skye/Saffron-Dusk-76973.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76973.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Saffron Dusk"title="Saffron Dusk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1740579ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1740579" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1659091">Evenlesscreative</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-22">01/22/23 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Working my way through the Portraits samples, and so far this is my favorite of the 'feminine' scents, and I would definitely consider this 'unisex' if you're into gendering scents. Complex vanilla- oud compbo with a nice spiciness I suppose from the cardamom. I think I can see how some might find it slightly medicinal, my guess is that's the fir note coming through, but I really like it. Keeps it from being sickly sweet. I'll see how long it lasts, as I have been disappointed with the longevity of a number of the Portraits. <br />
<br />
I just realized as I was about to submit this, this smells very familiar, and though I like it I think it is maybe just a toned down, softer version of spicebomb extreme, which I love (and is much cheaper).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1740579"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1740579#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1733025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1733025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lmnsvgz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259533.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lmnsvgz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Oriana-69117.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69117.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oriana"title="Oriana"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1733025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1733025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533">lmnsvgz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-13">01/13/23 08:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very smoky oud, the cardamom is blended well, almost cannot separate it from the other notes. The base is quite sweet, vanillic. There is something a bit medicinal about this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1733025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1733025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1726002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1726002" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ninamariah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1588494"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1588494.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ninamariah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Isola-Sol-91214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Isola Sol"title="Isola Sol"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1726002ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1726002" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1588494">Ninamariah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-05">01/05/23 12:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I want to write my review right now because I think in totally different way about this like many others and maybe this gives a different perspective for someone who is trying to understand what kind of the scent is this. <br />
<br />
I like this scent a lot and since I was a little bit disappointed with the Portraits line this was the one which pop out and I liked this, after two weeks I love this.  My problem just was that I found this similar to something I already have. I was thinking and thinking and finally I found it: Initios Psychedelic Love. I know, there is REALLY different notes in those two and vanilla cant explain the similarity which I smell in any kind of way. I dont know how I can feel like this and if anyone feels the same? I just know that the opening and the dry down smells similar: PL is more intensive, deeper, more narcotic and long lasting while BY is all the time from the opening until the end more soft and weaker. The one thing why I write this review now: I was reading reviews after testing this now during two weeks and I dont find anything similar to MFK Oud Satin Mood. OSM is powdery, oud vanilla rose and all those notes are in balance and you can really easily tell what is going there without reading the notes anywhere. In BY there is oud and there is vanilla but not even vanilla is so obvious. There is many notes beautifully blended in BY and I love both scents and if you own another one you definitely need to get your nose to another because those are TOTALLY different scents, beautiful different kind of scents. And if you like another one its not so obvious that you like both. For me the big question is: do I need a weaker version of Psychedelic Love? Those are definitely not the same but the smell in my left and right wrist appears pretty similar.<br />
<br />
I hope someone got the idea, my English is not so perfect though. Enjoy your perfumes. <br />
<br />
Thank you for reading and I would appreciate a lot if you want to follow me on IG: @ninamariah_perfumes</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1726002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1726002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1722849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1722849" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tooombie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516190"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516190.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tooombie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1722849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1722849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516190">tooombie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-01">01/01/23 21:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Probably one of my favourites in the collection. The beginning is a nice warm spice with strong oud. A little be medicine-y but that how oud usually smells for me. <br />
<br />
The dry down was a soft, not sickly sweet vanilla that oddly smelt like a really high quality paw paw cream. <br />
<br />
Couldnt smell any jasmine notes but still a really good perfume! Shame its so expensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1722849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1722849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1716268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1712493" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GrenadeGirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1633901"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1633901.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GrenadeGirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floraiku/Spring-River-96555.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96555.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spring River"title="Spring River"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1712493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1712493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1633901">GrenadeGirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-19">12/19/22 05:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unlike Constance, this one does at least have a bit of substance.<br />
<br />
Headline for me - it's just OK. I struggle with the astringent slightly toilet cleaner top notes, but they dry down to quite a pleasant mildly spicy but green fragrance.<br />
<br />
It's very unusual, but that doesn't make it brilliant.. at least, not for me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1712493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1712493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1704998" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The incense is gorgeous over the florals! I wear this when I want to feel like a mysterious femme fatale.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1704998"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1704998#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1700513" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1700513" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cohno"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/179110"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.179110.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cohno" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Empressa-Eau-de-Parfum-67818.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67818.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Empressa Eau de Parfum"title="Empressa Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1700513ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1700513" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/179110">cohno</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-02">12/02/22 07:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>All i get is Spicy Jasmine &amp; incense ... I'm not put off by the spiciness as I feel like its a motif of this Portraits line ( see Changing Constance as well) ...<br />
However how about some saffron? Or something sweeter? I feel like that would have gone better than smelling like gingerbread after the florals go .. <br />
<br />
Conflicted - that's how I can summarise this scent &amp; a bit dissapointed</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1700513"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1700513#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1696717" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1696717" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scissorslizardspock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1026213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scissorslizardspock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Henry-Rose/Blonde-Barry-83558.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83558.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blonde Barry"title="Blonde Barry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1696717ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1696717" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213">Scissorslizardspock</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-26">11/26/22 16:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was so very excited to try this!  I love the stories and the idea for this line from Penhaligons.  Sadly, while I can smell beautiful oud, cardamom, incense and vanilla - there is a hefty cloud of something very synthetic (maybe ambroxan? Or iso e?) - something so thick it ruins the rest of those glorious notes for me.  Im sure its my nose, Im sensitive to some of the newer more popular aroma chemicals, and I dont smell them like the majority of noses do.  If these notes were available without the aroma chemicals, it was be perfect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1696717"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1696717#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1696598" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1696598" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glassfury"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1519213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1519213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glassfury" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nicolai-Parfumeur-Createur/Fig-Tea-2037.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2037.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fig Tea"title="Fig Tea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1696598ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1696598" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1519213">Glassfury</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-26">11/26/22 13:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Begins with a plummy blast that I blinked and reeled from, but gosh what a delectable sensual affair. Very reminiscent of the Poison and Hypnotic Poison line with that heavy, luscious vanilla base and something jammy on top when you first spritz it on. However the base of this is very different. Some hours later the unmistakeable oud oozes out and clears away everything else. Not a casual wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1696598"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1696598#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1696366" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1696366" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Clairexoxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617341"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1617341.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Clairexoxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1696366ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1696366" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617341">Clairexoxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-26">11/26/22 06:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The dry down is extremely beautiful, warm, delicious, feminine, and inviting. I am obsessed with the dry down in which I find the notes to be subtle but well blended. And it makes me sad because I do not really enjoy the opening which is very aromatic, in a medicinal way... think Vicks vaporub. It's a 7/10 overall. It would be a 10/10 if the opening was friendly and not so in your face.<br />
<br />
Edit: Okay, after a few weeks, the scent in the sample changed a bit and the off-putting opening got significantly milder and shorter... I am now in love with the fragrance!<br />
To me I mainly smell a bit of the medinical cardamom, a pleasant oud and strong incense as well as a combination of vanilla + coffee which comes off a bit chocolate-y on my skin. Though it is so incense-y that it may not be very wearable for a lot people</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1696366"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1696366#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1692346" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324517">amandawilliamspalmer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-20">11/20/22 04:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful for fall and winter. My 4 year old daughter has complimented me on this twice so it must be crowd pleasing. She says it smells of marshmallow. I get that. It is a sweet, woody, vanilla scent. Of all my collection in this profile - Ensence Suave, By the Fireplace, Shalimar, Absolute Aphrodisiac - this is my favourite. Just a fantastic blend. Well done Penhaligons.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1692323"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1692323#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1688019" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290650">Mr. Boston</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-04">11/04/22 15:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is absolutely gorgeous. Forget the haters, you need to get your nose on this. Its marketed towards women but it is truly a unisex sent. Oud, chocolate, woods, touch of iris and rose? What more could you want? It smells to me like a combination of Nasamottos Pardon mixed with Penhaligons Sohan. 10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1681059"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1681059#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1679192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1679192" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Forbiddenjade"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/359188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.359188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Forbiddenjade" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Prive-Vert-Malachite-34588.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34588.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Prive Vert Malachite"title="Armani Prive Vert Malachite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1679192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1679192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/359188">Forbiddenjade</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-02">11/02/22 06:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have to say, trolls here are really annoying. This could easily be mistook for Oud Satin Mood of MFK! I own both and I can tell without doubt as I'm testing them both right now. <br />
<br />
As to why people down voted Oud Satin Mood, I'd really like to know their reason. Test this to believe folks!<br />
<br />
Definitely unisex, churchy if you wish as here the incense is a tad more prominent while the candy floss note just detectable. However, the two scents are very similar. They could be mother and daughter for how they perform on skin. <br />
<br />
Due to the more prominent incense note, this needs a particular mood to be wore, because it really is more alike a spiritual scent, so to speak. One to wear for introspective moments rather than to go out. Not for office, dinners, least dates unless it's Halloween. Maybe funeral perfect, as it's sombre and somewhat melancholic... (!) too much incense!<br />
<br />
Great, but redundant in my collection as I own Satin Mood. A lovely number, 10 for quality 5 for projection. We'll see about longevity. Btw, this bottle is ugly, really! No connection to the fume, and neither something that'll look nice on a dresser. It gives me the creeps, reminding of some pagan when not demonic icon... never I'll put it on show.<br />
<br />
Update: longevity really poor. After 2 hours it was gone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1679192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1679192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1666029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1666029" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="flyprincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224920"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1224920.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="flyprincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Prive-Bleu-Lazuli-48059.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48059.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Priv Bleu Lazuli"title="Armani Priv Bleu Lazuli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1666029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1666029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224920">flyprincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-14">10/14/22 10:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A softer, slightly more mass appealing version of Lune Feline.  Its nice, and it does have coffee added.  But Atelier Des Ors did it first (and slightly better, imo).  Nevertheless, this is a good scent.  Its cozier in a way.  I will prob use this one for fall and LF for winter.  Or maybe this to top up at end of night, for those close encounters.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1666029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1666029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1661521" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1661521" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pinkstate"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/102741"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.102741.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pinkstate" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Wild-Madagascar-Vanilla-28154.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28154.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wild Madagascar Vanilla"title="Wild Madagascar Vanilla"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1661521ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1661521" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/102741">pinkstate</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-08">10/08/22 04:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm not fan of the opening but on my skin the dry down is a mix of baby powder, honey, vanilla and incense. I like it during fall and winter. Projection and longevity are strong.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1661521"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1661521#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1655532" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1655532" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Noha8"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236790"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Noha8" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Liquides-Imaginaires/Blanche-Bete-70189.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70189.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche Bte"title="Blanche Bte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1655532ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1655532" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236790">Noha8</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-29">09/29/22 11:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love it. I really love it. Sweet creamy deep cardamom on a very background of jasmine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1655532"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1655532#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1651920" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1651920" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JmThms"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293565"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293565.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JmThms" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escada/Escada-pour-Homme-1364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escada pour Homme"title="Escada pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1651920ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1651920" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293565">JmThms</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-24">09/24/22 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The gender ratings for this is another example of the influence fragrance name and marketing has on perception.  This scent profile is far, far more unisex than the gender ratings here on Fragrantica indicate. In fact it is just as masculine-leaning as it is feminine-leaning, and maybe more so. To further illustrate this consider Amouage Reflection Man has a decidedly masculine gender rating on Fragrantica yet in reality it is far more feminine a scent profile than The Bewitching Yasmine. This is similar to Tom Ford Black Orchid in this regard. Part of my Fragrantica comment on Black Orchid says "....Think of it all this way: if this leaned feminine then why would there be so much qualification in the descriptions of the types of women who this would be appropriate for? "powerful, confident, mysterious". "A witch". Not mainstream<br />
feminine. Lol.". Same with The Bewitching Yasmine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1651920"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1651920#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1651510" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1651510" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rcates78"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343852"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1343852.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rcates78" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tommy-Hilfiger/Tommy-Girl-3016.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3016.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tommy Girl"title="Tommy Girl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1651510ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1651510" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343852">Rcates78</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-23">09/23/22 16:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What to say about The Bewitching Yasmine that hasn't already been said?  Today was my first wear of this fragrance (got a sample from LuckyScent) and on first application I was reminded of Noxzema!  There's a bracing blast, right up front, of something astringent that was shocking, but not entirely off-putting.  Where on earth does it come from???  Could it possibly be the jasmine?  After an hour or so, it's backed into it's cage with several loud commands and a crack of the whip, and provides a surprising counterbalance to the other notes which are warm and dark.  I am definitely an oud newbie, so lord knows which of the threads I detect in this composition is representative of it, but there's sweet spice, subtle jasmine, smoke, and incense, creamy vanilla bean and coffee, and....Noxzema.  That astringent note hangs out the entire day, sulking in the background but readily detectable to my nose, even hours later, which leads me to believe this is on purpose, and not my sample being off.  The whole composition is like an art installation, with all the elements present to be examined at your leisure, rather than a musical composition that unfolds over time.  It's relatively linear in presentation, with the notes meandering and slinking around and past each other for hours.  I find it rather pleasant and intriguing, but it is not an instant love I have for Yasmine.  Many of the longest lasting and strongest relationships are NOT love at first encounter, however, so at the very least, I am willing to pursue her to the end of my sample.  I am not entirely bewitched, just yet, but my interest is certainly piqued.<br />
<br />
Edit:  After a few weeks of sauntering around town with Yasmine, I have found she's totally worth my time.  I think it's the weather that's brought out the best in her.  We have cooled off and entered a more humid time of year here in SoCal and it really suits her.  Tones down the bracing Noxzema scent and allows more of the wood and spice to infuse the whole composition.  Definitely a seasonal romance, but one worth the heartache of inevitable separation.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1651510"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1651510#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1646071" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1646071" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thenosenknows"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570181"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="thenosenknows" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1646071ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1646071" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570181">thenosenknows</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-15">09/15/22 21:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Okay so this one is really confusing with me. <br />
<br />
I think the name is spot on, because I do really find it bewitching, I got a sample and used it a few months ago and found my thoughts coming back to it over the course of the next 6 months. <br />
<br />
That being said.. there is something off about this fragrance to me. It opens with a note that is so sickly and cloyingly sweet that it ruins the entire perfume for me. I can't put my finger on exactly which note is causing it, perhaps it is the cardamom which is translating somehow as a grape or violet syrup or purple hubbabubba.<br />
  <br />
This is the kind of perfume which will take probably 3 hours before it is bearable on the skin. Then it turns into something quite incescey, oud, smoky, sensual and spiritual. <br />
<br />
But the wait isn't worth it in my opinion, not for what seems like quite a simplistic drydown, and the incredibly high price point of this perfume. <br />
<br />
Some people will adore this, because it is bewitching, but if you like really complex mature scents I would pass because this is so sweet. <br />
<br />
Oh also it lasted forever on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1646071"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1646071#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1640174" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1640174" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pnnbread"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1542612"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pnnbread" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12201.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal 33"title="Santal 33"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1640174ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1640174" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1542612">Pnnbread</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-07">09/07/22 09:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am in love with this scent. To me, this fragrance strikes a perfect balance: it's spicy but smooth, smoky but creamy, syrupy but not sticky, bold but not too heavy. Equal parts spicy, sweet and smoky. The cardamom opening is a bit harsh for my liking but when it dries down the spice falls back to reveal the other notes, all of which can be identified. Rose and oud is a well loved pairing but oh my god, the jasmine and oud together in this fragrance is so wonderful. The jasmine note is very clear and other notes really bring out its' rich, musky, carnal sweetness. The fir and coffee notes add a lovely supporting role here as well. <br />
I would say it's feminine leaning but unisex. Not too overwhelming to wear on a Fall and Winter's day, IMO.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1640174"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1640174#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1634099" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1634099" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="electricwitchard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="electricwitchard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1634099ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1634099" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561732">electricwitchard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-30">08/30/22 00:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have long used Fragrantica reviews as my perfume bible to explore and test new scents. The comments and reviews have gone so right so many times (Musc Ravageur, my signature scent) and wrong only once (Black Orchid, a syrupy sweet headache) so when I first bought The Bewitching Yasmine I knew I had to make an account to pay it forward and leave my first review. <br />
<br />
This perfume is perfect. I cannot fault it. Its the scent I have been searching for my entire life. Its the femme fatale, its sex appeal, its the woman/person you want to be. The vanilla is grown up, not anything like the imitation vanilla shoved in every celebrity perfume. The coffee is like that boujee coffee shop you go in sometimes to treat yourself because they have the best croissants and its a social faux pas to order anything with milk. And hours later (5-6 on my skin) youre left with a stunning, stunning oud. <br />
<br />
I have never been so torn as to save this for the most special occasions, or drown myself in it every day. <br />
<br />
Buy this perfume. Or dont, so Im the best smelling person in the room.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1634099"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1634099#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1631971" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1631971" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mizur"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1503389"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1503389.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mizur" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/Sensual-40563.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40563.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sensual"title="Sensual"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1631971ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1631971" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1503389">mizur</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-26">08/26/22 13:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is an amazing creamy smoky oud love it!!<br />
<br />
The Oud, Cardamom and Vanilla are wonderfully present the Coffee and Incense are magnificently blended lending their particular aromas without overpowering the rest the Jasmine and Fir could not be detected, at least not on my skin.<br />
 <br />
Imagine yourself at the end of the most amazing dinner your dessert arrives and its the most decadent smoked salty vanilla confection thats what The Bewitching Yasmine is.<br />
<br />
Projection is moderate for the first hour, then it becomes intimate Longevity is between 5 to 6 hours Penhaligons is not great with performance, and unfortunately this perfume is no exception.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1631971"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1631971#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1627211" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1627211" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marshaleo819"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434020"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marshaleo819" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Kissing-Burns-6-4-Calories-A-Minute-Wanna-Workout-50496.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50496.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kissing Burns 6.4 Calories A Minute. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1607635" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ALICIADONOVAN"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1539065"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ALICIADONOVAN" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1607635ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1607635" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1539065">ALICIADONOVAN</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-21">07/21/22 08:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I adore this perfume. Its a captivating, dark, alluring, hypnotic fragrance that wears extremely well. Somehow, the heavier cardamom, incense and coffee notes are light enough that they dont sit heavy in a room. The vanilla and jasmine notes are perfectly intertwined with the smoke and spice, preventing it from being too sweet. All of this combined, creates an intoxicating, intriguingdare I say, bewitching, fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1607635"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1607635#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1602299" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1602299" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rrruples"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1381161"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1381161.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rrruples" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1602299ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1602299" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1381161">rrruples</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-13">07/13/22 12:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to love this perfume because of its stunning bottle and the Portraits storyline, but I'm not obsessed. Smells like what I'd imagine mouthwash would smell like if they added vanilla to it. Other than that visual, I can hone in on the coffee and the incense, but too sickly sweet as I find most vanilla fragrances to be. <br />
<br />
Just a like, not a love. Would buy if was a third of its price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1602299"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1602299#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1582258" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1582258" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="seliko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1373236"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1373236.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="seliko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1582258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1582258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1373236">seliko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-11">06/11/22 06:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i dont know if this makes sense, but this fragrance to me smells like jasmine syrup. very unique and interesting! it's like they thought, people are used to -and even bored of- jasmine nowadays, it's overdone and they have a strong opinion on it, so how do we display jasmine as differently as possible, yet as pleasant as possible?<br />
<br />
it's very far from the designer brand or clothing store jasmine perfume. very far from the "my grandma used to smell like this." the best part is, its uniqueness doesnt make it repulsive or too much to wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1582258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1582258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1579478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1579478" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FLSR"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495951"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1495951.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FLSR" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1579478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1579478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495951">FLSR</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-07">06/07/22 09:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yasmine has to be one of my all time favourite scents. It is rich, sweet, spicy and you feel special wearing it. I find myself walking past my perfume collection, picking it up, removing the heavy metal cat head just to smell the atomiser (it is that nice!) It's a shame about the longevity. I am a massive over sprayer (5-7 sprays) and by hour 4 I cannot smell it on myself unless I put my nose up close to my skin. For 210 a bottle this is disappointing to say the least, but I got it free on promotion so I cannot really complain.<br />
<br />
I would recommend getting a sample to try to see how it performs on your skin before splurging on a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1579478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1579478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1576636" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1576636" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellgewd1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1469293"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1469293.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellgewd1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Jacobs/Daisy-Love-49108.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49108.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daisy Love"title="Daisy Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1576636ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1576636" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);
