I don't really like oud but this one surprisingly very okay and wearable to me. reminds me a lot of oud satin/silk mood by MFK.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1576636"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1576636#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1572631" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Sounds amazing!! I've been obsessed with Incense after buying a pure Olibanum oil and sniffing Vanilla Barka. YUM! Fir, caramel, incense with a deep coffee note is what I imagine. Do you also imagine smells?<br />
<br />
I don't like the comparison of dark deep rich scents being "witchy" it feels the next thing will be Voodoo or Majic..  Witch's are good and bad entities in one like all of us!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1572631"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1572631#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1566862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821">Cherry_Darling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-19">05/19/22 04:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice scent, strong cardamom and woods, however I find this incredibly sweet. That is coming from a gourmand lover but here it feels too much. Maybe I'm spoiled by my spicies and cardamom frags, which tend to be more focussed on the spice nuances, here I feel like it's a huge dose of sugary vanilla taking over the whole scent. Still nice though if you love gourmands with cardamom. <br />
<br />

Cardamon, vanilla with a touch of coffee. It is like you mix intense caf with cardamon. Very sexy, excellent sillage and longevity.<br />
9/10 I love it!<br />
<br />
For winter, for myself, in this brand: Yasmine (cardamon, vanilla, coffee) &gt; Constance (caramel &amp; cardamon) &gt; Duke (rose, wood, pepper).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1560333" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Plogic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/964475"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.964475.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Plogic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Ambre-Nuit-7092.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7092.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Nuit"title="Ambre Nuit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1560333ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1560333" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/964475">Plogic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-09">05/09/22 09:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tested this at Scent Bar in NYC a few months ago and finally decided to go for it...I'm a guy in his 40's and find this one rather unisex or even male-leaning. There's a spiciness to this that conjures up the smell of a very interesting hippy-vibed thrift store with undertones of a dialed-back Black Afghano. Reminiscent of what I'd imagine San Francisco in the late 60's might have smelled of...I just love this one!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1560333"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1560333#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1555912" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1555912" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cinnamontopography"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1497279"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1497279.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cinnamontopography" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1555912ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1555912" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1497279">cinnamontopography</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-03">05/03/22 02:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Came across this while hunting for my new go-to scent. <br />
<br />
I do not care for the orientalist imagery for this one, and I wasn't entirely sure what to think upon the initial sniff. Thought it was medicinal and sharp at first, but after a while it really grew on me. <br />
<br />
I enjoy "witchy" imagery and I'm drawn to anything incense (frankincense and myrrh are my bffs) - it's my personal mission to smell like a cathedral  - but this didn't give me any incense at all, or at least, not the smokey kind. I still enjoy it though.<br />
<br />
Overall, it has a vibe that I enjoy projecting: pleasant, yet mysterious. Dark femme. What's in my bag? Probably a knife.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1555912"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1555912#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1548534" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; as I smell alot of simularities to that. But a lovely milky, creamy coffee, caramel,  jasmine and oud fragrance. <br />
Very addictive I can't stop smelling my arm.<br />
<br />
Update; I got lancome OB for now but I'm sure I'll add Bewitching jasmine at some point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1548534"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1548534#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1546310" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1546310" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BoutiqueLove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249602"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BoutiqueLove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1546310ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1546310" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1249602">BoutiqueLove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-19">04/19/22 03:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Delicious, sexy and unique fragrance. <br />
Creamy smooth milk coffee, rose syrup, cardamom, pistachio and hint of smoky oud. <br />
This smells like an exotic Arabian princess!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1546310"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1546310#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1544175" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1544175" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Idismee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1168396"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1168396.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Idismee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Sorriso-21853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sorriso"title="Sorriso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1544175ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1544175" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1168396">Idismee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-15">04/15/22 13:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My signature fragrance, and I know it will stay so for a long, long time.<br />
<br />
I first encountered Yasmine around two and half years ago, when I was in search for a scent that would capture all of my favorite aesthetics: Oscar Wilde's hedonistic lifestyle; seance parties of the1920s; Arabic coffee and spices; dark, heavy velvet against naked skin; Mata Hari's mesmerizing and dangerous silhouette...<br />
<br />
For me, it was magic at first spritz.<br />
<br />
The way I see it, Yasmin is a thousand-year-old druid's soul in the body of a young, mesmerizing mistress. She doesn't need attention, but she gets it anyway. People either fear her or crave her. Either way, she's just here on earth to indulge in earthly pleasures for the time being, and occasionally share ancient knowledge to those she deems worthy... and just when you think you're about to know her, she'll disappear on the next full moon, never to be seen again... Leaving only a hint of warm, edible vanilla on your clothes to remember her by.<br />
<br />
The opening is sweet and juicy but not quite innocent; boozy but in control... And it keeps developing... the cardamom coyly peeks from over a delicate silk fan; the incense takes your hand and leads you out onto the marble floor; the oud wraps its arms around your waist; and a creamy vanilla whispers sweet nothings onto your skin until the next morning... It's one long, luxurious dance between notes.<br />
<br />
Sillage is perfect - as long as you don't over-spray yourself (two sprays suffice for me), people will get passing whiffs of this mysterious scent. A few people have now commented on the vanilla note, and how it captured their hearts immediately - especially whenever sprayed on my chest. It lasts all day for me - though I enjoy wearing it a few hours before bedtime so that I can wake up to that hint of warm vanilla in the morning as well.<br />
<br />
If you are a fan of incense &amp; (amazingly blended, inoffensive) oud but want to also lean gourmand &amp; feminine, this is seriously worth a try. It's not a scent that everybody will click with - many people seem to think it smells like a cathedral, and I can see that too, especially if you're not into incense. I like to think it smells like the halls of an ancient temple, full of offerings of sweets and spices. Or Oscar Wilde's candle-lit parlor. Enough with all my imagery, though... I suggest you try this on your skin for a day, and see what images it evokes for you.<br />
<br />
It's dark femininity in a bottle. A masterpiece by Penhaligon's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1544175"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1544175#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1527492" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1527492" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zeynarees"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476100"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zeynarees" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1527492ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1527492" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476100">Zeynarees</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-21">03/21/22 09:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can honestly say this is the best perfume Ive ever owned. Makes me feel like Im walking through a mossy carpeted forest as the smell of oud, incense and spice floats through the air. A very warm and comforting scent, definitely a head turner. Probably the best out of the portraits collection in my opinion, and the smell progresses so beautifully on your skin over time. At first spray its a very strong rich scent mainly the warm jasmine and spice, then over time it calms down to a smoky and sensual mixture of oud incense and little hint of vanilla, but not the kind where its super sweet and gives you a headache. Makes you feel so sexy and mysterious, and I still smell it the next day when I wake up! Ive only ever used this in the winter so not sure how suited it would be to warmer weather but from what Ive smelled so far I think it would be suited to all temperatures. I think it is unisex but maybe leaning towards the feminine side a little bit. Definitely a unique and amazing scent, probably not so safe to blind buy but if you want something exotic, mysterious, oudy and smokey that makes you feel dreamy then I would definitely recommend getting a sample and trying it out!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1527492"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1527492#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1525694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1525694" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SailorV"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/955817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.955817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SailorV" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1525694ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1525694" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/955817">SailorV</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-18">03/18/22 08:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm very interested in floral ouds beyond the usual rose/oud combo, and I found a dreamy one in The Bewitching Yasmine. <br />
<br />
This is clearly oud, but one of the softest and most feminine versions of it I have ever smelled. <br />
Nothing dirty or screechy-medicinal here, just enough sharpness to make sure it can't be confused with other woods. It's almost fluffy. Together with a warm, syrupy, opulent jasmine it builds a sensual floriental accord. <br />
The other notes are all soft and well-blended, too. The cardamom note in the opening is the same as in Changing Constance, both have a Swedish pastry vibe which I really enjoy. Otherwise this is not a gourmand though, I'd rather describe it as a sensual woody floriental. <br />
The vanilla is subtle here, it's part of what makes the scent so smooth and round, but it doesn't stand out. I'm surprised it's voted so highly on this page, maybe I just don't find it strong because I'm used to more vanillic perfumes. I also don't find the coffee all that intense, if anything it's more reminiscent of super dark chocolate than literal coffee. I love coffee and usually always want more of it, but in this case it doesn't matter, the scent is great as it is. It's as bewitching as the name claims, a beautiful and unique treat especially for the colder seasons.<br />
<br />
I don't see the resemblance to Oud Bouquet, Shaghaf Oud and scents in that vein. They're rosy and this is more spicy instead, and they have sharper oud notes. I also feel like this is not quite as loud and in-your-face, even though it's still a great performer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1525694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1525694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1524072" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1524072" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ladyfatma"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1393606"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1393606.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ladyfatma" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bohoboco/Vanilla-Black-Pepper-45675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Black Pepper"title="Vanilla Black Pepper"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1524072ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1524072" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1393606">Ladyfatma</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-16">03/16/22 01:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>                       </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1524072"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1524072#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1517983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1517983" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cynthia30"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/974071"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.974071.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cynthia30" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floraiku/In-The-Dark-73175.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73175.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="In The Dark"title="In The Dark"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1517983ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1517983" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/974071">Cynthia30</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-06">03/06/22 21:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I had to smell this blind, I would say it's deer musk, vanilla and a synthetic suede note that smells terrible.  <br />
<br />
Remove the deer musk and you have something like Tom Ford Vanilla Fatale. <br />
<br />
Also have you tried Este Lauder Youth Dew? It's heavy on real cinnamon, but it's the cousin of TBY.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1517983"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1517983#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1512542" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1512542" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Daisy_D"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1258353"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1258353.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Daisy_D" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1512542ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1512542" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1258353">Daisy_D</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-26">02/26/22 12:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A gourmand fragrance. Caramel coffee with cashmeran scent..Balsamic and a bit tea like.. Reminds me of multiple smoky black tea fragrance..One of my favourites among the Penhaligon's Portraits!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1512542"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1512542#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1500993" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1500993" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rosegold"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/985684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.985684.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rosegold" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1500993ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1500993" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/985684">Rosegold</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-09">02/09/22 13:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This opens with grape-syrup jasmine and dries down to a generic sweet oud-vanilla base.  I wish I could smell the fir and incense listed in the notes to break up the boring sweetness.  Perhaps its been reformulated since the time of launch? Its certainly not bewitching now.<br />
In 2022, this perfume retails 383CAD and can be picked up on the gray market for around 220-250.  Feels expensive for a perfume that been done many times over and only lasts for 4 hours. Youre probably better off picking up Oud Bouquet or one of its many knock offs for a similar feel and better price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1500993"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1500993#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1497031" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1497031" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sewist"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1444183"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sewist" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Portrait-of-a-Lady-10464.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10464.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Portrait of a Lady"title="Portrait of a Lady"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1497031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1497031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1444183">Sewist</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-03">02/03/22 12:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This does start with a sharp note, but very quickly quiets down to a warm, spicy and complex fragrance. The hint of jasmine and vanilla soften the edges and bring a femininity to the otherwise masculine notes. It settles into a sensual, lightly floral, spicy oud with a touch of sweet sharpness around the edges to keep it intriguing. <br />
<br />
As a teenager I worked in a small food shop at the mall that delivered meals to employees at other shops. There was a smoke shop that specialized in loose pipe tobacco and cigars, both of which are 10x more complex smelling than any cigarette. The owner worked alone, so I got to deliver to his shop all the time. Because of what he sold, he had to keep the shop door closed, so the scents were that much more amplified. It was glorious! I still adore those smells even though I dont smoke cigarettes. Yasmine isnt technically a tobacco scent, but that shop came to mind immediately. Smokey is in the notes, so that may be where this association was born.<br />
<br />
Obviously, perfumes are vastly different on each person, but theres no cloying sweetness or any kind of overt candy smell on me. Im 56 and have no desire to smell like a teenager. The small amount of sweetness just balances the other notes on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1497031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1497031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1489768" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1489768" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nnfigui"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1392441"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nnfigui" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1489768ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1489768" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1392441">Nnfigui</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-24">01/24/22 05:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This broke my heart!<br />
I was expecting to love this but the truth is I didn't..<br />
<br />
all I get on my skin .. is baby powder and anise( which I'm not a fan), after an hour I was able to tolerate more but .. nope not my favorite.. specially for the price and hype..<br />
<br />
<br />
update..<br />
<br />
After testing it out for a couple of days, and getting over the fact that it didn't smelled anything like what I've expected .. I've seen to like it and wear it quite a lot ... after about an hour i can't smell the anise and enjoy more the sweetness. I still think its overpriced and more of sweet, innocent scent rather than a sexy, intoxicating scent.. doesn't smell like anything on my collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1489768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1489768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1486150" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1486150" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Annabear"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1039259.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Annabear" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Eau-Suave-5625.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5625.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Suave"title="Eau Suave"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1486150ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1486150" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039259">Annabear</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-18">01/18/22 23:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A syrupy warmer Santal Kardamon with an abstract coffee note, frustrating if youre pining for the coffee  because youre only going to get an impression of it. Theres also a note thats mildly liquorice, or could be cola, but is probably closer to quinine, Im not a chemist and I am only guessing. <br />
Its interesting, I guess you could say its a spicy gourmand. It projects reasonably well with average staying power.  Im getting pho (Vietnamese beef soup) from it, probably because the larger black cardamom (the one that looks like nutmeg, not the soft smaller green ones) features in pho, so I wont be chasing this one. I love pho but dont want to smell like it.<br />
Review based on a 2ml sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1486150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1486150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1485420" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1485420" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iszzieanna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234905"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1234905.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iszzieanna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1485420ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1485420" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234905">iszzieanna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-17">01/17/22 23:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm getting two completely different fragrances depending on when I smell this. On one hand, it's for a younger crowd. there's a syrupy sweetness in this. It's almost like over-ripe berries with marshmallows on top. It makes the fragrance very immature and for a younger crowd. The fragrance stays sickly sweet and this prolongs through the life of the scent.<br />
<br />
But on the other hand, this smells like a more middle eastern centred fragrance. I get the incense along with rubbery and synthetic oud. Not the cold and metallic type, the burning tar type. On top I get a sight bit of warm cardamom and sugary vanilla. There's no coffee to be found which ever way this scent pulls.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1485420"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1485420#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1477529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1477529" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cdarrach"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046034"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1046034.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cdarrach" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coromandel-Eau-de-Parfum-41783.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41783.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coromandel Eau de Parfum"title="Coromandel Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1477529ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1477529" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046034">cdarrach</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-06">01/06/22 10:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I might dislike the Penhaligons base formula?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1477529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1477529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1476558" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1476558" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Florence27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/869831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Florence27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Psychedelic-Love-45977.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45977.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Psychedelic Love"title="Psychedelic Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1476558ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1476558" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/869831">Florence27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-05">01/05/22 00:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I may have found the oud fragrance that matches with my chemistry.<br />
Well, obviously, it's not centered exclusively on oud, but I don't see any other way I could appreciate it.<br />
It starts with a quite strong, medicinal oud, which could discourage you, if you, like me, don't get along with this particular note, however stick around, I have a feeling that you will be pleasantly surprised.<br />
Soon after, I get jasmine, a fresh one at that, so light and airy, it's like being in a spring garden. A prominent lavish cardamom with an ever so slight coffee note come together.<br />
All these wonderful notes become rounded by a creamy vanilla and a faint smoky incense, along with the oud which returns mellowed down and velvety. The drydown is intoxicating.<br />
There is a distinct middle eastern touch to this fragrance, with an emphasis on the word 'touch', because it is definitely adjusted to the western approach on perfumes.<br />
The bewitching Yasmine is elegant and sensual at the same time. She has fully embraced the British lifestyle, while still having a few enchanting, oriental aces up her sleeve.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1476558"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1476558#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1463398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1463398" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mlleghoul"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/462232"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.462232.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mlleghoul" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/BeauFort-London/Terror-Magnificence-57012.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57012.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Terror & Magnificence"title="Terror & Magnificence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1463398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1463398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/462232">mlleghoul</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-14">12/14/21 14:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The copy for The Bewitching Yasmine from Penhaligons Portrait collection is kind of silly in a Regency romance sort of way Yasmines sights are set on London  and a suitable match. Her fragrance is a voluptuous affair: jasmine, incense, oud. A celebration of all that is gloriously sensual. Who could resist? But the musky shadows of this deliriously poisonous confectionery fairy tale floral reads less like a novel of manners and more like a New Wave Czechoslovakian gothic drama through a slightly sleazy and heavily decadent 1970s lens. And if in that word salad of melodrama you sussed that I am obliquely referring to a gloriously wicked character from the 1972 film Morgiana, then we are obviously besties. If youre not keeping up, thats okay, well visit another point of reference. Imagine the vanilla-dusted amaretto-spiked jasmine and sassafras latte of Diors Hypnotic Poison and lock it in a psychedelic velvet carpet bag with ouds bitter earthy fables, and the strange otherworldly poetry of cardamom incense. Bury the satchel for one hundred years in an abandoned cliffside cemetery, dig it up, air it out, and the resulting fragrance is The Bewitching Yasmine. Or, back to Morgianaalthough the actress who played the jealous and vindictive Viktoria was singularly, splendidly perfect, and no one could ever replace herimagine the divine tackiness of Peggy Bundy in that role? That is the very essence of Penhaligons The Bewitching Yasmine. This is a fragrance somehow both luxurious and trashy. What do we call the intersection of these things? Self-indulgent? Sinful? None of those really feels right. And theres something not quite right about this scent, toomaybe thats why its so much evocative fun.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1463398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1463398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1449213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1449213" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TunyaPe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.733870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TunyaPe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Fils-de-Joie-62872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fils de Joie"title="Fils de Joie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1449213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1449213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870">TunyaPe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-20">11/20/21 07:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>1st time: Yuck. Sickly coughing syrup.<br />
2nd time (4mo later): Had more patience and got more spicy cardamom, sweet roasted coffee, and a hint of incense &amp; oud. No jasmine detected.<br />
3rd time: Impressed by the sillage, projection &amp; longevity. The scent grew on me as it has got that dim, mysterious, spicy, oriental element that I look for. It is bewitching and seducing indeed, though not witchy.<br />
4th time: Layered this over my oud oil to enhance the note and I was in heaven.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1449213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1449213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1449037" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1449037" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GnomeChompskey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416722"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1416722.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GnomeChompskey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Santa-Maria-Novella/Citta-di-Kyoto-11419.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11419.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Citta di Kyoto"title="Citta di Kyoto"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1449037ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1449037" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416722">GnomeChompskey</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-19">11/19/21 22:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I read a previous review that remarked this brought to mind feelings of sadness, I feel 'Melancholic' would be a better descriptor. I really enjoyed this scent although i am a little bit of an emotional masochist. It smells expensive and makes you want to hold your nose to the wrist of the person wearing it forever. I do wish the coffee note were more prominent and that the price were a little cheaper. <br />
Longevity: 10/10<br />
Originality: 6/10<br />
Quality: 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1449037"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1449037#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1446091" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1446091" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gleeeeen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1411966"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1411966.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gleeeeen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Heartless-Helen-55442.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55442.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Heartless Helen"title="Heartless Helen"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1446091ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1446091" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1411966">gleeeeen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-15">11/15/21 00:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The initial note, is a very warm and spicy cardamon that dries down to a smooth but loud projection incense, vanilla, coffee, jasmine and a touch of oud. This fragrance is a sweet fragrance after the dry down and just smells like pure heaven, this can be used by both men and women. Just pure sexy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1446091"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1446091#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1431288" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1431288" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tirput"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309616"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1309616.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tirput" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1431288ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1431288" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309616">tirput</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-20">10/20/21 05:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The Bewitching Yasmine is one of a kind. A burst of cardamom is the first thing my nose picks up upon the spray. I hardly stand cardamom in general, but this one here feels fine because the coffee notes will immediately emerge, making the spice tolerable. 10-ish minutes after the initial spray the incense-y feeling starts to appear with a spicy twist. And there comes the oud. Surprisingly the entrance isn't loud, but you'd know it's there. Spoiler: it never leaves. The oud will be there for the next hours along with the vanilla.<br />
<br />
Much to my surprise the dry down is quite subtle and intimate. In my head, the combination of oud, incense, and vanilla would create a loud statement and could only be worn on nighttime occasion. Boy I was wrong! If you're bold and daring enough, you can even pull this fragrance off during the day without feeling guilty to those around you. Go abuse the liquid and make it your signature scent. I kid you not. For me, I'd only wear this on those days where I'm feeling down and need an instant #Girlboss confidence boost. Not my typical everyday scent.<br />
<br />
Despite the intimidating red liquid, I guess this is suitable for those who wants to start the journey of discovering oud. All the notes are well balanced and well blended, nothing is overpowering the other. I can't help myself but sniffing my skin throughout the day. It's just SO good. But I suggest to always try sample or decant first before committing the full bottle, which of course will cost you plenty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46504"comment_id="1431288"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Bewitching-Yasmine-46504.html?ccid=1431288#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1429365" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
